description.short_desc: Actions for working with .NET Tree objects
Action to expand a node according to its text value.
Case-sensitive text of node to expand
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to expand. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: This action expands the "Parent" node.
This action expands the "Child" node found under "Parent".
Action to blindly expand a node according to its text value.
description.detailed_desc: Generally, no pre- or post- node checks are done. If the tree contains hidden root nodes the user must provide these.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive full path text of node to expand
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to expand. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->". If the tree contains hidden root nodes the user must provide these.

description.short_desc: This action blindly expands the "root->Parent" node.
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node 'root' is provided as required.

description.short_desc: This action blindly expands the "Child" node found under "Parent".
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node 'root' is provided as required.

description.short_desc: Action to expand a node according to a partial match of text value.
Case-Insensitive text of node to match.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-insensitive text of the node. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->". For each level, a text comparison is performed. If the node contains the requested substring anywhere in its text, then that node is considered a match.

description.short_desc: This action successfully expands the "My New Parent" node.
This action successfully expands the "My Stepchild" node found under "My New Parent".
Use ExpandTextNode instead.
Case-sensitive text of node to expand
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to expand. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: This action expands the "Parent" node.
This action expands the "Child" node found under "Parent".
Action to collapse a node according to its text value.
Case-sensitive text of node to collapse
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to collapse. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: This action collapses the "Parent" node.
This action collapses the "Child" node found under "Parent".
Action to blindly collapse a node according to its text value.
description.detailed_desc: Generally, no pre- or post- node checks are done. If the tree contains hidden root nodes the user must provide these.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive full path text of node to collapse
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to collapse. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" If the tree contains hidden root nodes they must be provided.

description.short_desc: This action blindly collapses the "Parent" node.
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node 'root' is provided as required.

description.short_desc: This action collapses the "Child" node found under "Parent".
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node 'root' is provided as required.

description.short_desc: Action to collapse a node according to a partial match of its text value.
Case-Insensitive text of node to collapse
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-insensitive text of the node to collapse. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" For each level, a text comparison is performed. If the node contains the requested substring anywhere in its text, then that node is considered a match.

description.short_desc: This action collapses the "Parent" node.
This action collapses the "Child" node found under "Parent".
Use CollapseTextNode instead.
Case-sensitive text of node to collapse
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to collapse. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: This action collapses the "Parent" node.
This action collapses the "Child" node found under "Parent".
Action to select a node according to its text value.
Case-sensitive text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to select. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: This action selects the "Parent" node.
This action selects the "Child" node found under "Parent".
Action to select a node according to a partial match of its text value, in addition to any nodes already selected. Performs selection as if CTRL key were held down during selection.
Case-Insensitive text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-insensitive text of the node to select. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" For each level, a text comparison is performed. If the node contains the requested substring anywhere in its text, then that node is considered a match.

description.short_desc: This action selects the "My New Parent" node.
This action selects the "My Stepchild" node found under "My New Parent".
Action to select a node according to its text value, in addition to any nodes already selected.
Case-sensitive text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to select. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: This action selects the "Parent" node.
This action selects the "Child" node found under "Parent".
Action to blindly select a node according to its text value, in addition to any nodes already selected.
description.detailed_desc: Generally, no pre- or post- node checks are done. If the tree contains hidden root nodes the user must provide these.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive full path text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to select. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" If the tree contains hidden root nodes they must be provided.

description.short_desc: This action blindly selects the "Parent" node.
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node is provided as required.

description.short_desc: This action blindly selects the "Child" node found under "Parent".
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node is provided as required.

description.short_desc: Action to select a node according to a partial match of its text value. Performs selection as if CTRL key were held down during selection.
Case-Insensitive text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-insensitive text of the node to select. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" For each level, a text comparison is performed. If the node contains the requested substring anywhere in its text, then that node is considered a match.

description.short_desc: This action selects the "My New Parent" node.
This action selects the "My Stepchild" node found under "My New Parent".
Action to blindly select a node according to its text value.
description.detailed_desc: Generally, no pre- or post- node checks are done. If the tree contains hidden root nodes the user must provide these.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive full path text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to select. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" If the tree contains hidden root nodes they must be provided.

description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node is provided as required.

description.short_desc: This action blindly selects the "Child" node found under "Parent".
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node is provided as required.

description.short_desc: Use SelectTextNode instead.
Case-sensitive text of node to select
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to select. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: This action selects the "Parent" node.
This action selects the "Child" node found under "Parent".
Copy the current contents of a tree[branch] to a file.
description.detailed_desc:
The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of each node. Use 'PartialMatchTreeDataToFile' if you wish to specify case-insensitive substring matches for tree nodes.
By default, the files will be stored in the active "Test" directory. If you specify a relative path, the path will be relative to the project directory. The directory for a full or relative path must already exist.

description.short_desc: The name of the file used to store the tree data.
description.detailed_desc: The name of the file used to store the tree data. By default, the files will be stored in the active "Test" directory. If you specify a relative path, the path will be relative to the project directory. The directory for a full or relative path must already exist.

description.short_desc: The full name of the tree branch to capture.
description.detailed_desc:
The full name of the tree branch to capture. If omitted, all branches/nodes are captured.
The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of each node. Use 'PartialMatchTreeDataToFile' if you wish to specify case-insensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

description.short_desc: The character(s) to use in the output file to indent the tree nodes from the parent tree branches.
description.detailed_desc: The character(s) to use in the output file to indent the tree nodes from the parent tree branches. If omitted, a tab character is used.

description.short_desc: Specify a character encoding to be used when saving data to a file. If it is not specified, the system default file encoding will be used. The encoding should be a valid string supported by Java; if it is not valid, the system default file encoding will be used instead.
(Future) Specify a file filter to use to process the text before comparison.
(Future) Specify filter options to use with the file filter.
Capture the complete nodeset of aTreeView to a file.
description.detailed_desc:
Data is stored in [project]\Datapool\Test\aFilename.ext file using tab chars to indent the nodes and branches. Because no Branch was specified, the data for the whole tree is captured.
Note the unused reserved fields for FileFilter and FilterOptions were omitted.

example.usage: T, Browser, aTree, CaptureTreeDataToFile, myDirectory\aFilename.ext, "Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust", "_"

description.short_desc: Capture the data contents from 'Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust' to a file.
description.detailed_desc:
Data is stored in [project]\myDirectory\aFilename.ext file using "_" chars to indent the nodes and branches. Because a Branch was specified, only nodes from that branch are captured.
Note the unused reserved fields for FileFilter and FilterOptions were omitted.

description.short_desc: Capture the complete nodeset of aTreeView to a file.
description.detailed_desc:
Capture the complete nodeset of aTreeView to a file.
Writing file with "UTF-8" encoding.

description.short_desc: Copy the current contents of a tree[branch] to a file according to a partial match of its text value.
description.detailed_desc:
The search of the path to the node is a case-insensitive substring match of each node. Use 'CaptureTreeDataToFile' if you wish to specify case-sensitive exact matches for tree nodes.
By default, the files will be stored in the active "Test" directory. If you specify a relative path, the path will be relative to the project directory. The directory for a full or relative path must already exist.

description.short_desc: The name of the file used to store the tree data.
description.detailed_desc: The name of the file used to store the tree data. By default, the files will be stored in the active "Test" directory. If you specify a relative path, the path will be relative to the project directory. The directory for a full or relative path must already exist.

description.short_desc: The full name of the tree branch to capture.
description.detailed_desc:
The full name of the tree branch to capture. If omitted, all branches/nodes are captured.
The search of the path to the node is a case-insensitive substring match of each node. Use 'CaptureTreeDataToFile' if you wish to specify case-sensitive exact matches for tree nodes.

description.short_desc: The character(s) to use in the output file to indent the tree nodes from the parent tree branches.
description.detailed_desc: The character(s) to use in the output file to indent the tree nodes from the parent tree branches. If omitted, a tab character is used.

description.short_desc: (Future) Specify a file filter to use to process the text before comparison.
(Future) Specify filter options to use with the file filter.
Capture the complete nodeset of aTreeView to a file.
description.detailed_desc:
Data is stored in [project]\Datapool\Test\aFilename.ext file using tab chars to indent the nodes and branches. Because no Branch was specified, the data for the whole tree is captured.
Note the unused reserved fields for FileFilter and FilterOptions were omitted.

description.short_desc: Capture the data contents from the first child node of 'parent' containing 'branch' to a file.
description.detailed_desc:
Thus, this could be a match for 'Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust'
Data is stored in [project]\myDirectory\aFilename.ext file using "_" chars to indent the nodes and branches. Because a Branch was specified, only nodes from that branch are captured.
Note the unused reserved fields for FileFilter and FilterOptions were omitted.

description.short_desc: Action to click a node according to its text value. Currently, this component function is for Trees and works differently than documented in TreeViewFunctions (though that functionality may be added in the near future).
Case-sensitive text of node to click.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to click. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: This action clicks the "Parent" node.
This action clicks the "Child" node found under "Parent".
Action to blindly click a node according to its text value. Currently, this component function is for Trees and may work differently than documented in TreeViewFunctions.
Case-sensitive full path text of node to click.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to click. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" If the tree contains hidden root nodes then they must be provided.

description.short_desc: This action blindly clicks the "Parent" node.
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node is provided as required.

description.short_desc: This action blindly clicks the "Child" node found under "Parent".
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node is provided as required.

Case-sensitive text of node to right-click.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to right-click. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: This action right-clicks the "Parent" node.
This action right-clicks the "Child" node found under "Parent".

Case-sensitive full path text of node to right-click.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to right-click. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" If the tree contains hidden root nodes then they must be provided.

description.short_desc: This action blindly right-clicks the "Parent" node.
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node is provided as required.

description.short_desc: This action blindly right-clicks the "Child" node found under "Parent".
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node is provided as required.

description.short_desc: Action to double-click a node according to its text value. Currently, this component function is for Trees and works differently than documented in TreeViewFunctions (though that functionality may be added in the near future).
Case-sensitive text of node to double-click.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to double-click. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: This action double-clicks the "Parent" node.
This action double-clicks the "Child" node found under "Parent".
Action to blindly double-click a node according to its text value. Currently, this component function is for Trees and may work differently than documented in TreeViewFunctions.
Case-sensitive full path text of node to double-click.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to double-click. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" If the tree contains hidden root nodes then they must be provided.

description.short_desc: This action blindly double-clicks the "Parent" node.
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node is provided as required.

description.short_desc: This action blindly double-clicks the "Child" node found under "Parent".
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node is provided as required.

description.short_desc: Verify that a tree contains the provided node.

detailed_desc.p: The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of each node. Use 'VerifyTreeContainsPartialMatch' if you wish to specify case-insensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

description.short_desc: The name of the node to verify.
description.detailed_desc: The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of each node. Use 'VerifyTreeContainsPartialMatch' if you wish to specify case-insensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

example.usage: T, Browser, aTreeView, VerifyTreeContainsNode, "Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust"

description.short_desc: Verify the node 'Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust' is found in aTreeView.
Verify that a tree contains the provided node according to a partial match of the node's text value.

detailed_desc.p: The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-insensitive substring match of each node. Use 'VerifyTreeContainsNode' if you wish to specify case-sensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

description.short_desc: The name of the node to verify.
description.detailed_desc: The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-insensitive substring match of each node. Use 'VerifyTreeContainsNode' if you wish to specify case-sensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

description.short_desc: Verify that a child node of 'parent' containing 'branch' is found in aTreeView.
description.detailed_desc: Thus, this could be a match for 'Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust'.

description.short_desc: Sets a user-defined variable with the result of whether a tree contains the provided node.

detailed_desc.p: The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of each node. Use 'SetTreeContainsPartialMatch' if you wish to specify case-insensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

description.short_desc: The name of the node to verify.
description.detailed_desc: The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of each node. Use 'SetTreeContainsPartialMatch' if you wish to specify case-insensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

description.short_desc: The name of the variable which gets assigned the result.
description.detailed_desc: The value of 'TRUE' indicates the node was found in the tree, and 'FALSE' indicates that the node was not found in the tree.

example.usage: T, Browser, aTreeView, SetTreeContainsNode, "Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust", isFound

description.short_desc: Variable isFound will be set to 'TRUE' if the node 'Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust' is found in aTreeView. If not found, isFound will be set to 'FALSE'.
Sets a user-defined variable with the result of whether a tree contains the provided node according to a partial match of the node's text value.

detailed_desc.p: The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-insensitive substring match of each node. Use 'SetTreeContainsNode' if you wish to specify case-sensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

description.short_desc: The name of the node to verify.
description.detailed_desc: The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-insensitive substring match of each node. Use 'SetTreeContainsNode' if you wish to specify case-sensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

description.short_desc: The name of the variable which gets assigned the result.
description.detailed_desc: The value of 'TRUE' indicates the node was found in the tree, and 'FALSE' indicates that the node was not found in the tree.

description.short_desc: Variable isFound will be set to 'TRUE' if a child node of 'parent' containing 'branch' is found in aTreeView. If not found, isFound will be set to 'FALSE'.
description.detailed_desc: Thus, this could be a match for 'Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust'.

description.short_desc: Action to blindly CTRL-click a node according to its text value. Currently, this component function is for Trees only.
Case-sensitive text of node to CTRL-click.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to CTRL-click. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: This action CTRL-clicks the "Parent" node.
This action CTRL-clicks the "Child" node found under "Parent".
Action to blindly SHIFT-click a node according to its text value. Currently, this component function is for Trees only.
Case-sensitive text of node to SHIFT-click.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to SHIFT-click. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: This action SHIFT-clicks the "Parent" node.
This action SHIFT-clicks the "Child" node found under "Parent".
